This seems to be some problem with file access. The video export first exports a temporary video file for the rendering and then combines it with the audio and outputs the final video. You seem to have no access on the temporary written video file. Did you check if the temporary video file exists and can be played with some video player? I have never tried to run VOCA under Windows, so there could be compatibility issues with the video export.

Hello,
I am using Windows 10; I need installation instructions on Windows 10. Could you please help me with that? Also, I have a problem installing "mesh processing libraries from MPI-IS/mesh within the virtual environment".

This maybe a problem caused by tempfile on Windows. [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23212435/permission-denied-to-write-to-my-temporary-file](url)

Turn to 'utils/inference.py',

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5697909/165210077-41426bb4-8522-4bd6-a365-54c2eac332dd.png)
